com.wikitude.architect
Class ArchitectView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.ViewGroup
          android.widget.FrameLayout
              com.wikitude.architect.ArchitectView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent
public class ArchitectView
extends android.widget.FrameLayout

UI Component encapsulating Camera, render surface and Webview. "Entry Point" to the SDK which exposes all SDK functionality. Instantiating and adding this Component to the UI should be sufficient to use ARchitect in any application. Can be added in code and via xml.

Attention: currently should only be added with layout parameters (layout_width and layout_height) to fill_parent

callJavascript

public void callJavascript(java.lang.String jsCmd)
Executes the passed javascript string in the context of the currently loaded ARchitect World. This can be used to pass data to the ARchitect World or to notify it of external events.

Parameters:
jsCmd - javascript string to call

load

public void load(java.lang.String urlString)
          throws java.io.IOException
Replaces the existing content of the ArchitectView with the one from the supplied url. This usually is an ARchitect World.

Parameters:
urlString - url-string of architect-world to load
Throws:
java.io.IOException - exception thrown in case url was invalid

public void setCullingDistance(float distance)

method that allows to set a threshold distance, where objects further away than the distance will not be seen. default is 50km

distance - in meters as float
